tool.name: PyProphet_score
tool.description: Error-rate estimation for MS1, MS2 and transition-level data
tool.command:
pyprophet score --in='$input' --classifier=$conditional_classifier.classifier
#if str($conditional_classifier.classifier)=='XGBoost': $conditional_classifier.xgb_autotune #end if #if $apply_weights: --apply_weights #end if --xeval_fraction=$xeval_fraction --xeval_num_iter=$xeval_num_iter --level=$level --ss_initial_fdr=$ss_initial_fdr --ss_iteration_fdr=$ss_iteration_fdr --ss_num_iter=$ss_num_iter --ss_main_score='$ss_main_score' --group_id=$group_id $parametric $pfdr --pi0_lambda=$pi0_lambda_start $pi0_lambda_end $pi0_lambda_steps
--pi0_method=$pi0_method --pi0_smooth_df=$pi0_smooth_df $pi0_smooth_log $lfdr_truncate $lfdr_monotone --lfdr_transformation=$lfdr_transformation --lfdr_adj=$lfdr_adj --lfdr_eps=$lfdr_eps --ipf_max_peakgroup_rank=$ipf_max_peakgroup_rank --ipf_max_peakgroup_pep=$ipf_max_peakgroup_pep $tric_chromprob $test_mode --out='./output.osw' && mv *_report.pdf report.pdf

param.name: input
param.label: Input file
param.help: This file needs to be in OSW format (--in)

param.label: Either a 'LDA' or 'XGBoost' classifier is used for semi-supervised learning

param.name: xgb_autotune
param.label: XGBoost: Autotune hyperparameters
Apply PyProphet score weights file instead of semi-supervised learning.
The data level selected for scoring. 'ms1ms2' integrates both MS1- and MS2-level scores and can be used instead of 'ms2'-level results
Data fraction used for cross-validation of semi-supervised learning step
Number of iterations for cross-validation of semi-supervised learning step
Initial FDR cutoff for best scoring targets
Iteration FDR cutoff for best scoring targets
Number of iterations for semi-supervised learning step
Main score to start semi-supervised-learning
Group identifier for calculation of statistics

param.name: parametric
param.label: Do parametric estimation of p-values

param.name: pfdr
param.label: Compute positive false discovery rate (pFDR) instead of FDR

param.name: pi0_lambda_start
param.label: Use non-parametric estimation of p-values. Start value

param.name: pi0_lambda_end
param.label: Use non-parametric estimation of p-values. End value

param.name: pi0_lambda_steps
param.label: Use non-parametric estimation of p-values. Steps value
Either 'smoother' or 'bootstrap'; the method for automatically choosing tuning parameter in the estimation of pi_0, the proportion of true null hypotheses
Number of degrees-of-freedom to use when estimating pi_0 with a smoother

param.name: pi0_smooth_log
param.label: If True and pi0_method = 'smoother', pi0 will be estimated by applying a smoother to a scatterplot of log(pi0) estimates against the tuning parameter lambda

param.name: lfdr_truncate
param.label: If True, local FDR values >1 are set to 1

param.name: lfdr_monotone
param.label: If True, local FDR values are non-decreasing with increasing p-values
Either a 'probit' or 'logit' transformation is applied to the p-values so that a local FDR estimate can be formed that does not involve edge effects of the [0,1] interval in which the p-values lie
Numeric value that is applied as a multiple of the smoothing bandwidth used in the density estimation
Numeric value that is threshold for the tails of the empirical p-value distribution
Assess transitions only for candidate peak groups until maximum peak group rank
Assess transitions only for candidate peak groups until maximum posterior error probability
Maximum isotope overlap to consider transitions in IPF
Minimum log signal-to-noise level to consider transitions in IPF. Set -1 to disable this filter

param.name: tric_chromprob
param.label: Whether chromatogram probabilities for TRIC should be computed

param.name: test_mode
param.label: Run in test mode with fixed seed

tool.help:
**What it does**
PyProphet: Semi-supervised learning and scoring of OpenSWATH results.
Conduct semi-supervised learning and error-rate estimation for MS1, MS2 and transition-level data.
PyProphet is a Python re-implementation of the mProphet algorithm (Reiter 2010 Nature Methods) optimized for SWATH-MS data acquired by data-independent acquisition (DIA). The algorithm was originally published in (Telemann 2014 Bioinformatics) and has since been extended to support new data types and analysis modes (Rosenberger 2017, Nature biotechnology and Nature methods).
